channel.description: Recent content in Home on Nervous

item.title: Getting Started
item.description:
Getting 10-4 running in your server takes just a few minutes. The bot uses an interactive setup wizard that guides you through configuration without touching any config files.

Prerequisites

Before starting, make sure you have:

  • Administrator permissions in your Discord server
  • A channel for the ticket panel (where users will click to create tickets)
  • A support role for your team members
  • A log channel for ticket transcripts

Step 1: Invite the Bot

Contact us to get 10-4 added to your server. We’ll provide an invite link with the correct permissions pre-configured.

item.title: Google Gemini Discord Server
item.description:
What is its purpose?

The community provides a constructive feedback source for their developer team, allowing them to interact with users on a more personal level to better assess consumer sentiment and needs surrounding the product. Free from the distraction of most social channels, community members are able to give more thoughtful, honest feedback, and connect with members of their development team in a smaller and more intimate setting.

What nervous delivered

nervous worked with their brand engagement team to create a private Discord server with gated enrollment and user verification systems. nervous served as a direct liaison between Discord and the client, helping the client understand server culture and how best to use the platform to accomplish their messaging and feedback gathering goals.

item.title: Commands
item.description:
10-4 uses Discord slash commands for setup and management. All commands start with /.

Slash Commands

Command Description Who Can Use
/setup_ten_four Launch the interactive setup wizard Server Administrators
/ticket Manually create a ticket Anyone
/ping Check if the bot is online Anyone

/setup_ten_four

Starts the configuration wizard to set up 10-4 in your server. This command:

  • Creates a private setup channel
  • Walks you through panel, role, and log channel selection
  • Can be run again to reconfigure settings

/ticket

Creates a ticket without using the panel button. Useful for:

item.title: David Choe's Munko
item.description:
What is its purpose?

Client and their team wanted to create an evolving membership card token that reflected the changing nature of their art and granted the holder access to a unique, experiential community centered around their art, media appearances, and personal spiritual journey.

What nervous delivered

nervous set up a custom Discord server and crafted a “make them wait” strategy, launching with only one channel, no explanation, and a moderation team who became part of the overall storytelling.

item.title: Less Than Jake
item.description:
What is its purpose?

Create a membership-based fan club and online community that allowed the band to connect with fans, offer fun exclusives, and deliver demo tracks, merch discounts, and other insider info.

What nervous delivered

nervous created a Discord server that served as the home base for the first official fan club for the 30-year old band. nervous handled all server architecture and ongoing moderation and community management.

We then worked with the creator of the bands iconic mascot to develop a unique collection of membership tokens that featured imagery from their entire discography and history.

item.title: Multiple Categories
item.description:
10-4 supports multiple ticket categories, allowing you to route different types of requests to different teams.

How Categories Work

Instead of a single “Create Ticket” button, your panel can show multiple buttons:

  • üõ†Ô∏è Technical Support ‚Üí Routes to your dev team
  • üí≥ Billing Questions ‚Üí Routes to your billing team
  • üí¨ General Questions ‚Üí Routes to community managers

Each category can have its own:

  • Name and emoji for the button
  • Support role who can see tickets in that category
  • Description to help users choose the right category

Setting Up Categories

During the setup wizard, you can add multiple categories:

item.title: Transcripts
item.description:
Every ticket generates a complete transcript when closed. Transcripts provide a permanent record of support interactions for audit trails, quality review, and training.

What’s Included

Transcripts capture the complete ticket history:

  • Messages ‚Äî Full text of every message in the ticket
  • Authors ‚Äî Who sent each message (username and ID)
  • Timestamps ‚Äî When each message was sent
  • Attachments ‚Äî Links to any files shared in the ticket
  • Embeds ‚Äî Content from any embedded messages

Transcript Format

Transcripts are saved as text files with a clear, readable format:

item.title: Inactivity Reminders
item.description:
10-4 monitors ticket activity and sends reminders when tickets sit idle too long. This prevents support requests from falling through the cracks.

How It Works

The bot runs hourly checks on all open tickets:

  1. Checks the last activity timestamp for each ticket
  2. Compares against your configured threshold
  3. Sends a reminder to tickets that exceed the threshold
  4. Tracks which tickets have been reminded to avoid duplicates

What Counts as Activity

Activity is tracked when:

item.title: Troubleshooting
item.description:
Having trouble with 10-4? This guide covers the most common issues and their solutions.

Bot Doesn’t Respond to Commands

Check if the bot is online

Look for the bot in your server’s member list. If it shows as offline (gray dot), the bot may be experiencing downtime.

Verify permissions

Make sure the bot has these permissions in your server:

  • View Channels
  • Send Messages
  • Use Application Commands

Wait for command propagation

Discord can take up to an hour to propagate slash commands to all servers. If you just added the bot, wait and try again.
